info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 14 at 3:52PM PST until December 15 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO NOON PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches, mainly above 500 feet. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...In Washington, Greater Vancouver Area. In Oregon, Greater Portland Metro Area. * WHEN...From 4 AM to noon PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Accumulating snow is expected primarily in the hills above 500 to 1000 feet, particularly west of the Willamette River and near the Columbia Gorge. Snow levels are expected to rise above 1500 to 2000 feet Wednesday afternoon.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
